author: CALI

core_concepts.definition: In the absence of a contradictory exception, a belief holds true or an action is executed.
A condition that overrides a default assumption or action.
A new piece of information that invalidates a prior belief.
The act of recursively re-evaluating a set of beliefs and actions in the presence of new data or conflict.
The process of identifying and resolving inconsistencies between a default and an exception.

learning_principles: A working assumption is better than no assumption.
Be willing to discard old conclusions in favor of new evidence.
A system must be able to justify why a default was overridden.
